Title: Interior Decorating Internship
Description:
,
Description:,
Interior Design/Decorating internship for an architectural and interior design firm in the Flatiron District. Intern will be working mostly with project designers on modern, high-end residential projects.  Responsibilities will be focused on FF&E, vendor correspondence, documentation of projects, installations and space planning. ,
,
Requirements:,
It is important and required you are fluent in Microsoft office/Excel, InDesign, Photoshop, and have experience in ACAD.  You must also be very fluent and well versed in the English language.  Intern must be a team player with a keen eye on detail and execution, as well as strong organizational and note taking skills.  ,
,
To apply:,
Please forward your details, resume and link to your portfolio or maximum of 3 MB of sample work. ,
,
About the company:,
We are a multi-tiered company specializing in architecture, interior design, and home furnishings. The scope of our company includes a modern, high-end architecture and interior design firm, home décor showrooms (3 locations), and a furniture and product design firm.,

Title: Special Inspector (Concrete)
Description:
,
Brooklyn based Class 1 special inspection firm seeking a Special Inspector.,
,
JOB FUNCTIONS,
This position will be responsible for performing or witnessing special inspections on New York City construction projects, including mid to high rise buildings.,
,
Candidate will be required to prepare reports on inspection activities, file documentation and complete required technical report forms in accordance with New York City Construction Codes.,
,
QUALIFICATIONS:,
Must have "ACI Concrete field testing technician" certification.,
,
Must have one of the following certifications;,
-ICC reinforced concrete special inspector,
or,
-ACI concrete construction special inspector,
,
Strong oral and written communication skills; ability to communicate in English. Follow directions, and interpret engineering and construction plans.

Title: Project Architect-Contracted Position
Compensation: Contracted Project Work That Pays by Project
Description:
,
Boutique architecture firm is searching for a Project Architect. Position available immediately.,
,
We offer a small team environment in a busy established studio, and the opportunity to develop further expertise in the design and construction of custom homes and apartments located primarily in Fairfield, Westchester, and NYC. ,
This is a PROJECT CONTRACTED position rather than a full time position (work and pay is project-by-project depending on availability of projects. Must know Archi-CAD in a Mac-based environment. Specifically looking for some one who can work on both independently and as an effective team member and have a successful history of managing projects in a fast-paced environment. Great opportunity to work on exciting and interesting projects.,
Requirements:,
,
• Bachelor's degree minimum,
• 10+ years residential architecture experience,
• Fluent in Archi-CAD and experienced in Mac-based environment.,
• Competency in preparation and management of contract documents, research, 3-D modeling, and rendering.,
,
,
To apply, please submit:,
,
• A cover letter stating relevant experience and skills;,
,
• A resume or CV that clearly documents the required qualifications;,

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Licensed RA or PE
Description:
,
, ,

As , New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to exterior restoration of buildings and infrastructure, continues our practice from a safe, socially responsible distance, we are proudly committed to keeping our superb staff intact for the duration of this crisis. In fact, we are presently open to augmenting our team, building on over thirty years of dedication to the preservation and renewal of buildings and infrastructure., 
We’re currently considering candidates who are NY State-licensed professional engineers or architects with 7 to 10 years of building-envelope experience. , 
We offer the resources of a large firm with the collaborative culture of a smaller studio, plus access to industry-leading technology and an in-house non-destructive testing lab.
If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio.,

,

Title: Assistant Project Manager / Facade Systems
Description:
,
Incredible opportunity for an ambitious Architect/Engineer or Construction professional with demonstrated experience and interest in facade and building envelope, to join a top national designer/fabricator/contractor of premier curtainwall systems. ,

As a result, we're seeking not people, not just with fundamental knowledge of facade through either the lens of a designer, engineer or contractor - but someone who has the interest to be front and center, on job-sites, dealing directly with owners and developers, making decisions, representing the brand and developing client-facing skills in a real world setting. Will assist in the management of the process from design through installation of major curtainwall and window wall systems for late commercial, residential and mixed use projects in NYC and throughout the region. Must be able to travel for work (within the northeast), expected travel in 20% range. ,
,
Must have BA/BS and 3 - 7+ years experience in a related design or construction environment. Strong communication skills, resourceful, entrepreneurial types preferred. ,

Title: Engineering Design Manager
Compensation: To be discussed with the Hiring Manager
Description:
,
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. PMG is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.,
,
The Engineering Design Manager will be responsible for serving as the managerial and technical lead for the division’s engineering and architectural designs and service delivery. You will manage the planning, execution, and growth of the division business of infrastructure, facility, and environmental design for projects across the world where Planate operates. This includes the consistent and coordinated execution of engineering, architecture, and environmental project deliverables resulting in satisfied clients and the creation of an effective base to build the business. ,
,
Key responsibilities:                     ,
,
Provide overall leadership to the Architecture and Engineering functions in Planate worldwide with a goal of client satisfaction and technical capabilities,
Oversee the project detailed design structure before submitting to clients,
Work with the Project Managers or Engineers on identifying the project risk and planning mitigation actions,
Implement the best practices, code standards, and use of technology in the execution of designs/delivery,
Provide weekly or monthly report in the form of accurate and detailed reports,
Partner with Planning and Engineering Services to pursue significant opportunities together. Also, the team with BD to produce compelling proposals that win work,
Responsible for Division Profit and Loss (P&L) operations, charged with actively managing the operations of AED to achieve the division’s financial targets,
Ensure that the staff is competitive and properly utilized, undue risk is avoided, and backlog is built to sustain the operation,
Maintain awareness of industry trends (such as related-technology, green design), educates staff and modifies practices,
Utilize computer-assisted design software and equipment to support project designs and plans when necessary,
Partner with HR to recruit, evaluate and hire quality candidates,
Lead the staff with a focus on developing talent and providing innovative and effective technical solutions and assure the skills necessary for successful execution are available; ensures the overall development of our professional,
Develop the complete AED staff to improve skill levels and deliver services and stay abreast of evolving needs in the marketplace,
Assemble effective execution teams with other Planate elements and strong go-to-market partners outside Planate to present the most compelling solutions to our client’s needs,
Maintain professional licensing in Virginia and other states as required for you and your staff,
Assist in administrative matters with your division related to licensing, insurance, training, compensation etc.,
Provide support for Planate as may be required.,
,
Qualifications to be successful in the role:,
,
Required degree in any field of Engineering,
Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) with a full set of signed and sealed portfolios, required,
Minimum of fifteen years’ experience in architectural and engineering design with desired work experience in health care facility design and construction projects,
Highly skilled in developing and mentoring engineers,
Handled large government projects,
Ability to identify process and design improvements,
Strong leadership, alignment, and interpersonal skills, and ability to work well with a diverse and worldwide team of professionals,
Possesses expertise in determining short-term, mid-term, and long-term impacts of business new concepts or new systems as they relate to military requirements,
Must be eligible to apply for a secret clearance,
Must be a US citizen and hold valid, current drivers’ licenses,
Proficient in English both written and verbal,
Planate Management Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.,
,
Why Planate?,
,
Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a Global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We Take Care of Our Own; Personally and Professionally, Up and Down The Line.  ,
,
We’d love for you to be a part of our Global workforce, helping us serve as an effective and integrated partner to advance every client's mission!

Title: Job Placement after training, certification and paid internship
Compensation: Paid internship for 175 hours; you will be paid $15 per hour after graduation prevailing wages jobs opportunity
Description:
,
AHRC NYC is offering a FREE 16 week training program for Youth in NYC who would like to go into one of the best paid job - janitorial, custodial. ,
,
Careers in Environmental Services program is offering each student an opportunity to get a certificate from ISSA Cleaning Management Institute and become Certified Custodian Technicians in 16 weeks. ,
,
The program is funded by DYCD for youth aged 16-24.,
,
• Program services are provided remotely - technology provided when needed.,
• Participants will receive a weekly stipend during the remote classroom and hands-on training. This is a 16 week program with one year follow up services.,
• Upon completion, successful graduates will receive job placement services.,
• Graduates will receive internationally recognized certification from ISSA Cleaning Management Institute and become Certified Custodian Technicians- Basic Level (Advanced is available for students),
• The program is open for youth 16-24 years of age who are economically disadvantaged,,
are out of school and do not have a college degree. Individuals with disabilities are welcome,
• Learn various janitorial techniques such as high and low dusting, sweeping and mopping floors, washing walls, glass, mirror, chrome polishing, sanitization of bathrooms, buffing floors, dusting furniture and other fixtures, proper disposal of garbage, and handling various types of cleaning supplies. Special training on COVID-19 Disinfecting Services,
• Hands-on training in a variety of janitorial tasks at renowned NYC healthcare institutions,
• OSHA 10 General Industry Certification,
• Career counseling to help you sort out what you really want for the future,
• Paid internship for 175 hours for $15 per hour to learn janitorial work,
,
Call today to book your spot! Next Cohort Starts 11/09/2020

Title: ater Treatment Specialist/ Chemist
Compensation: To be discussed with the Hiring Manager
Description:
,
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.,
,
The Water Treatment Specialist/ Chemist will be responsible for the complete operations and maintenance of the water production at three (3) complex reverse osmosis membrane filtration treatment plants and the distribution systems to ensure that the water is safe, aesthetically pleasing, and meets operational and mission needs and its requirements. This is to support the UEM Operations Supervisor and UEM Product Line Director who reports to the Public Works Director, the head of the Public Works Business Line (PWBL).,
,
Services will be performed at NAVFAC EURAFSWA, NAS Sigonella, Italy.,
,
Accommodation will be shouldered by the Company. ,
,
Key responsibilities:,
,
Coordinate all work with contractors, other Navy staff, and other PWD personnel,
Develop performance standards, typically under the cognizance of the UEM Branch Head/Director of Operations.,
Plan and develop water-related operations and maintenance projects including emergency, service and minor work,
Advise UEM Branch Head of required large capital improvements, specific work, and Major Maintenance projects for long-range planning goals and take or recommend appropriate action,
Provide weekly updates on the status of repair efforts for in-house and contractor actions,
Review and evaluate work methods, assignments, and staffing and act to reduce costs and increase productivity; must be knowledgeable in the use of MAXIMO work management application to monitor, measure and control productivity and costs,
Follow official policies and directives and comply with regulations for use of public funds and materials,
Coordinate, plan, schedule and execute duties to ensure delivery of quality and economical services,
Directly operate, maintain, repair, and manage the drinking water treatment plant (WTP) and distribution system (including cross-connection and backflow prevention equipment under the jurisdiction of the UEM business line) to ensure that water is safe, aesthetically pleasing, and meets operational and mission always needs and requirements (24hrs/day). Provide weekly updates on the water distribution status, including status on known leaks and repairs,
Manage and oversee drinking WTPs and distribution systems under the jurisdiction of the UEM, FMS (BOSC Contract) or AM (Lease) business lines. Provide biweekly updates on Sanitary Survey findings,
Maintain operator logs and site logbooks according to the Overseas Drinking Water Plant Operational Logs and Site Log Books Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Prepare daily situation reports for key plant parameters for NAS I and NAS II,
Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.,
,
Qualifications To be successful in the role:,
,
Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or any related field of study,
With Specialized knowledge and experience in the following: water chemistry; potable water operations, maintenance, and monitoring; water production wells; complex water treatment/filtration plants; water pump stations; elevated and ground-level water storage systems; distribution systems including mains, fire hydrants, customer service connections, backflow prevention, meters, blow-offs, and air/vacuum release valves; and overall technical expertise to solve a broad range of water quality problems,
Knowledgeable in technical and procedural guidelines pertaining to water systems and current editions of the Italy Final Governing Standards (FGS), Navy Overseas Drinking Water (ODW) program, European/Italian Drinking Water Legislation, Navy Uniform Facilities Criteria guidance for potable water systems, and industry-wide standards including International Plumbing Code, International Mechanical Code, American Water Works Association Standards and Manuals of Practice,
Certified in Water Treatment and Distribution Operator in accordance with the Association of Boards of Certification – Water Treatment Certification Class III and Water Distribution Certification Class I or higher or a U.S. State Certification comparable to these levels of certification,
Able to communicate orally and in writing to make technical and managerial presentations,
Proficient in using Microsoft Office suites,
Must be a US citizen.,
Planate Management Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.,
,
Why Planate?,
,
Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a Global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We Take Care of Our Own; Personally, and Professionally, Up and Down The Line. ,
,
We’d love for you to be a part of our Global workforce, helping us serve as an effective and integrated partner to advance every client's mission!

paola@cmceny.com ,
 ,

Title: CAD Drafter/CAD Draftsperson
Description:
,
Job Title: CAD Drafter/CAD Draftsperson,
Job Type: Full-time,
Schedule: Monday to Friday 8 hour shift,
Location: Flushing, NY,
Work Remotely:No,
Pay & Benefits:  DOE,
Language:,
* English (Required),
* Mandarin (Preferred),
,
Architectural Senior Draftsman needed to be part of a New York-based rapidly growing real estate developer. Attention to detail is very important in this position as you’ll be the lead checker of final plans. These detailed drawings incorporate the input of Architectural Designers, Interior Designers, MEP Engineers and Project Management team.,
,
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:,
,
* Field measure project and prepare existing condition plan(s).,
* Execute measurements on site as necessary to update drawings & provide accurate dimensions/graphics.,
* Check existing drawings and documents and create full construction drawings and documents.,
* Develop drawings based on 3D models, images, renderings, or any necessary sketches or hand drawings for each area/room of a designated project.,
* Present CAD drawings, elevations and sections as necessary.,
* Prepare schematic design submittal under direction from sales/design.,
* Prepare Construction/Permit drawings.,
* Assist Sales and Design with material sections.,
* All other duties as assigned.,
* Coordinate with engineering and building officials.,
* Minor beam calculations.,
* CAD Drafting.,
,
,
REQUIREMENTS: ,
,
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in related field preferred.,
* Experienced in Architectural design and construction terminology, detailing, and construction principles.,
* Minimum 2 years architectural/drafting degree,
* Construction experience a plus.,
* AutoCAD and REVIT high proficiency required, Sketchup and 3ds Max a plus,
* Adobe Acrobat Pro, Excel, Word,
* Good organizational skills, with knowledge of construction methods and terminology.,
* Ability to read and analyze construction documents and blueprints, ability to read a scale.,

Title: Interior Designer - NYC
Description:
,
JOB DESCRIPTION:,
Award winning and notable NYC-based luxury residential interior design firm is seeking a dynamic residential interior designer for a full time position. The ideal candidate will have 4-6 years of design firm experience, exceptional organizational and problem solving skills, is meticulous with details, and enjoys collaborating in a team environment. They will also work independently with confidence, have a passion for design excellence, great leadership qualities, and excellent communication skills. Candidates will work directly with the Principal Designer and the team to manage and lead projects.  ,
,
ABOUT THE FIRM:,
The firm’s interiors are known for their warmth, artistic sensibility, impeccable attention to detail, and unique spirit. The aesthetic embraces both art and design; each space is personalized and enlivened with exciting mixes of contemporary and vintage pieces, along with very special site-specific commissions. Our closely knit team is a collaborative group, drawing on each other's strengths,  collectively designing innovative and inspirational solutions and incredible designs. The studio culture is one of camaraderie, teamwork, and the feeling of pride for the excellent work we create.    ,
,
RESPONSIBILITIES:,
As a full time Junior Designer, you will be a part of a fun and dedicated team creating interior design concepts, presentations for clients, and technical documentation for manufacturers and artisans. This includes:,
   - Drafting floor plans, RCPs, and elevations in AutoCAD from site measures and for presentations,
   - Site measuring and templating,
   - Sourcing and specifying vintage and contemporary furniture, furnishings, and lighting,
   - Creating presentations, including detailed tear sheets,
   - Selecting fabrics and finishes with an excellent sense of color,
   - Generating scopes of work, creating and managing FF&E schedules and budgets,
   - Generating technical documentation for manufacturers and artisans, reviewing shop drawings and sketches,
   - Managing and following up on progress of work throughout all phases of design, fabrication, and construction,
   - Meeting with contractors during construction, ensuring all work is being executed per our drawings and specifications,
   - Implementing, processing and tracking all furniture and furnishings orders,
   - Scheduling all trades and vendors for installations, and coordinating all aspects of the install,
   - Providing strong organizational and relationship management skills throughout each facet of the design process,
   - We expect a deep knowledge of the design process and available resources, including custom furniture, construction, specifications, colors and materials,
,
REQUIREMENTS:,
   - Bachelors or Masters Degree from an accredited Interior Design Certified Program,
   - 4-6 years professional working experience,
   - Expertise in AutoCAD, Adobe Photoshop, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel necessary ,
   - Familiarity with 3D Software would be a benefit,
   - Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with excellent follow through,
   - Experience working with contractors, particularly on job sites, efficiently solving challenges on the spot,
   - Proficiency at sourcing items online and in showrooms,
   - Capable of working at a fast pace on multiple projects within a team environment,
   - Excellent written and oral communication skills,
   - Must currently live in NYC,
,
Please submit the following when applying: ,
Cover letter, resume, portfolio

•	Update spreadsheets for ongoing and prospective projects,
•	Calendar management,
•	Screen and answer phone calls when needed,
•	Draft, respond to, and monitor incoming and ongoing emails,
•	Assist with other administrative duties as needed.,
,
Qualifications:,
• Associate or Bachelor degree in related fields,
• 2+ year of work experience in an architectural, engineering or construction companies. Extensive knowledge of blueprint reading.,
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.,
• Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets,
• Familiar with Google Drive or iCloud.,
• Extremely detail-oriented, punctual, positive can-do attitude, and organized. ,
• Able to set priorities and to work independently or as part of a team.,
,
Small Office setting,
Business Casual Environment,
Salary based on experience,
,
How To Apply: ,
• Write your cover letter in the body of your email and indicate your availability (full-time or part-time) and salary requirements.,
• Attach resume in Word or PDF format only

Title: Structural Engineer Needed
Description:
,
Growing structural engineering firm seeks experienced engineer with 2-5 years of experience. Our project work includes residential, commercial and institutional projects. Experience with steel, concrete, wood and cold-formed design is a plus. Must be able to effectively communicate, both written and verbally. Job responsibilities include:,
,
Attend project meetings,
Prepare designs for projects,
Coordinate structural design with Owner/Architects,
Prepare detailed calculations,
Review project shop drawings,
Prepare structural drawings for drafting,
Conduct site visits (reliable mode of transportation is required),
Prepare inspection reports,
,
Candidates must have experience with the following software:,
AutoCAD,
Revit,
Excel,
ETABS,
RAM,
RISA,
,
Looking for the right candidate to grow with our firm. Please submit PDF copy of resume along with salary requirements.

Title: Senior Architect
Description:
,
Nelligan White Architects is a 25‐person firm located in New York’s Flatiron district. The majority of our design work is focused on municipal, cultural, education and multi‐residential housing projects, and we have been recognized for our expertise in resilience master planning and sustainability.,
,
Ideal applicants will demonstrate the following attributes:,
,
•	Highly motivated,
•	The ability to work independently and leading a team,
•	Exemplary verbal and written communication,
•	Senior level work experience with all phases of design and construction administration,
•	Experience with new construction and rehabilitation of buildings,
•	Be a conceptual thinker with strong technical skills (design and drawing),
•	Experience providing detailed construction documents ,
•	Experience writing specifications,
•	The ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment,
,
Responsibilities & Duties,
•	Prepare original architectural plans, diagrams and data visualization.,
•	Lead design assignments and supervise team progress.,
•	Independently evaluate, select and apply standard planning techniques, procedures, and criteria,
•	Using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.,
•	Recommend procedures in planning matters.,
•	Work from plans/designs of others to compile data and perform design computations.,
•	Assist in writing specifications.,
•	Visits construction sites to gather information.,
•	Receives instruction on specific assignment objectives and independently provides solutions for these objectives.,
•	Support Principal/Partners on large projects.,
•	Manage a team of intermediate to junior designers,
,
Qualifications,
•	10 years’ experience with a professional degree in Architecture and license in New York State,
•	High proficiency with AutoCAD. Adobe Suite knowledge is a plus.,
•	Strong analytical and conceptual skills and ability to grasp complex functional program requirements.,
•	Effective verbal and written communication skills.,
•	The ability to work well leading a team environment with a collaborative and professional work ethic.,
•	Experience working with large public agencies is a plus,
,
Apply with the following items attached as one PDF in a zip file, Please enter “Senior Architect” in the subject line.,
•	Cover letter,
•	Resume in PDF format,
•	Portfolio and work samples include renderings and construction document samples,
•	Salary requirements,
•	Two references that you have worked directly with in the last five years,
,
Nelligan White Architects offers a competitive salary and benefits package, which includes: medical, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending account, disability insurance, paid time off, holiday pay and 401(k) participation. This is a full‐time, exempt position.,
,
Nelligan White Architects, PLLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. Nelligan White Architects expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or veteran status.,
,
,

Title: Project Manager - Electrical / Data Construction - Large Firm
Description:
,
Company Overview: ,
We are a large-scale electrical contractor in NYC.  We are a family owned and operated business.  Our projects include data centers, museums, hotels, Telecom infrastructure, Sports Arenas, and office spaces for some of the leading companies and venues in the New York City area.  ,
,
About The Role: ,
We are looking for a full time Project Manager with 5-20 year's experience.  This position will work under one of the owners of the company.  They will be responsible for their own projects as well as assisting the owner in all aspects of electrical and communications construction projects to ensure project success.,
,
If you have knowledge and experience with Data cable and fiber wiring layout and install please be sure to note on resume.  This is a big plus. ,
,
Job Function: ,
-	Ensure field supervision has the instruction, material, and support that they need to succeed,
-	Address client and vendor concerns,
-	Proposal preparation and review,
-	RFI preparation and review,
-	Submittal tracking,
-	Monitor status of projects,
-	Contract administration,
-	Prepare billing requests,
-	Prepare basic estimates ,
-	Attend project meetings,
-	Conduct and prepare post-project analysis,
-	Take initiative and spear head initiatives to improve business practices,
,
Requirements: ,
-	5 - 20 years of experience as a project manager in the electrical / communications industry ,
-	Proficiency in Microsoft Office,
-	Knowledge of electrical construction,
-	Strong research and sourcing skills,
-	Must be able to manage multiple projects at once. ,
-	Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication ,
-	Travel to projects within NYC,
,
Preferred Qualifications: ,
-	Hands on electrical construction field experience,
-	Cooper and fiber install knowledge,
-	Radio RF cable antenna install knowledge,
-	Knowledge of Blue Beam and AutoCAD,
-	Prior electrical estimating experience,
-	Proficient in Google Suite of products ,
,
This position has excellent career advancement opportunities.  Most of our project managers have grown with the company since their employment. ,
,
Additional Information: ,
We are located in Long Island City Queens. Easily accessible by the 7, N,W,R,E,M, and F train. ,
,

Title: Structural Engineer
Compensation: The salary is based on level of experience.
Description:
,
Job Description:,
,
We are currently seeking structural engineers at multiple levels to join our team. As a structural engineer, you will work with other team members in our highly collaborative environment to assure that designs are developed in accordance with appropriate codes and standards, quality control objectives are achieved, and project goals are met within the schedule and budget. This is an outstanding opportunity for a structural engineer to work on a variety of high-profile projects throughout the region. ,
,
Duties and Responsibilities:,
,
- Coordinate with architects, contractors, owners, and other engineers from the initial planning stages through final construction.,
- Determine design criteria using relevant codes and standards.,
- Analyze and/or prepare models and calculations for various structural elements and systems by using various software and/or hand calculations.,
- Develop contract documents, including construction drawings and technical specifications,
- Produce schematic and detailed designs and evaluation of planning and concept alternatives,
- Review shop drawings, RFI's.,
- Perform field inspections and write inspection reports.,
,
Skills and Qualifications:,
,
- Familiar with latest version of AutoCAD, Revit, ETABS, SAP2000, SAFE, RAM, Excel.,
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills,
- Ability to effectively work independently and collaboratively in a team environment,
- Must be eligible to work in the United States,
,
Entry Level Candidates:,
- Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.,
,
Intermediate Level Candidates:,
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.,
- 3+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.,
,
Advance Level Candidates:,
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.,
- 8+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.,
- NYS PE License,
,
,
,

Title: Engineering Laboratory Technician
Description:
,
Our firm is seeking a skilled individual for a full-time laboratory technician position in our materials testing laboratory.  Our firm is involved in testing and analysis of a variety of construction materials, and a large fraction of our work focuses on historic buildings and structures.,
,
Candidates with 2-5 years of prior experience are preferred.  Responsibilities will include sample preparation (drilling, cutting, grinding, sieving, etc.), test performance, data entry and processing, writing/editing standard operating procedures, and potentially assisting in the fabrication and wiring of new test set-ups.  The candidate will also need to supervise one or two part-time labor staff.,
,
The successful candidate will:,
,
•	Be handy with basic hand and power tools and have mechanical aptitude.,
•	Enjoy practical work and not be afraid to get their hands dirty.,
•	Be highly detail-oriented and have the ability to work efficiently with great accuracy.,
•	Be a problem-solver and enjoy creating efficient work flows.,
•	Follow instructions without embellishment or deviation.,
•	Have the ability to work with deep focus and meet tight deadlines.,
•	Have good situational awareness and be able to monitor several lab operations at a time.,
•	Be proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.,
,
We plan to consider a wider range of candidates to fill this position depending on the pool of applicants that respond. ,
•	At one end would be someone very handy but with only limited practical experience.  That person might have good hand skills and a year or so of practical work experience in some type of engineering environment.  Minimum education might include some science or engineering coursework. ,
•	At the other end would be someone with several years of experience in a product testing environment who is comfortable with fabricating test rigs and has some electronics experience.  This person would have at least a 4-year degree in engineering or related field.,
,
If interested, please include a short cover letter along with your resume highlighting the characteristics that make you a good candidate for this position.  Applications missing a cover letter will be immediately discarded.,

We are a Small Architectural Firm located in Elmsford, NY seeking a motivated and responsible individual who is working towards or  possesses a bachelor and/or master degree in Architecture with prior office experience. Our firms primary work is in multi-family residential and commercial spaces. ,

Title: Project Manager / Architect
Compensation: Compensation to be commensurate with experience.
Description:
,
Michael Lewis Architects PC is looking for a talented and energized architect with 3-4 years practical experience to manage and work on a variety of engaging projects. Work includes design, project management, computer drafting, construction administration, and the full range of tasks needed to see projects through to completion. The firm is located along the Hudson River in Dobbs Ferry, NY, close to the train station about a half hour north from Grand Central Station on Metro North's Hudson Line.,
,
Our team is open, relaxed, and friendly. This opportunity offers a wide variety of experiences as well the potential for rapid growth and increased responsibility and control. MLA participates in the NCARB Architectural Experience Program (AXP) for those seeking to complete licensing requirements.  In response to COVID, arrangements for working remotely in conjunction with the office needs are open for discussion.,
,
Minimum Qualifications:,
-BArch or BS/Arch degree,
-At least 3 years of professional experience,
-Experience managing projects and in construction oversight,
-Strong CAD abilities (We use Vectorworks software: experience with it would be highly beneficial),
-Computer rendering experience,
-Strong communication skills and a collaborative spirit,
,
Desired Experience / Abilities: ,
-Photoshop,
-Website management and maintenance,
-Social media management,
-Microsoft office,
-Google suite,
,
The position offered is primarily full time, however, qualified part time candidates may also apply. Compensation will be commensurate with experience and ability. ,
,
To Apply: ,
Please email resume/CV and cover letter and reply directly to this posting. Feel free to attach portfolio or other relevant materials. Telephone inquiries regarding this position are not accepted.

Title: Project manager / expeditor
Description:
,
I need help getting the jobs through the DOB, I need someone who can go to the DOB and process the job... Send me your credentials/availability, I will review and follow up...thanks.

Title: Looking for freelance expeditors
Description:
,
We are an expediting company looking to work with a few expeditors on a freelance basis. Must have at least a Class 1 Filing Representative license from the DOB. ,
,
Most of the work we do is done online. So, we are looking to partner with a few expeditors to file work under their license. We will work closely with you on each project to make sure you know exactly what is being filed. Our office would set up the jobs/paperwork and submit. Only filing plumbing jobs in the DOB NOW: Build system would be done by the freelancers we work with. In addition, sometimes we need to go to the borough offices (mostly Manhattan and Brooklyn) to submit something in person. If you aren't able to submit things in person once in awhile - that's OK. We can still work with you.,
,
Types of jobs we do:,
,
- Alt-2 renovation filings,
- Pulling initial/renewal permits,
- Signing off jobs,
- Updating contractor insurance files,
,
Please contact us for more information.

Title: Mechanical Engineer for Rapidly growing medical device company
Description:
,
About Our Company:  ROM Technologies is a 4-year-old medical technology company that has created and patented two revolutionary medical devices (second high-tech device not shown on our website) which help patients recover from knee surgery faster and with less pain.  These first two pioneer devices are complete and are now to market.  Demand is intense, with orders from more than 500 physicians for 9,000 units already and growing quickly.  We are currently fulfilling these orders, and simultaneously scaling up our manufacturing to fulfill the booming demand.,
,
We proudly source every component in our devices domestically, making them true “Made In America” products.  We aim to design and build products that live up to the historic reputation of the finest American quality, and we seek new members of our team who would like to contribute to this goal.,
We are building a great, transparent, team-friendly environment with strong camaraderie and mutual respect which will be the foundation of an industry-leading design team.,
We seek an exceptional Mechanical Engineer for immediate hire, to work on-site, in our headquarters in Brookfield, Connecticut.,
,
The Mechanical Engineer will:,
Be responsible for supporting the mechanical engineering department.,
This person will interact with all ROMTech departments to achieve goals.,
 ,
Duties Include:,
- Designs mechanical and electromechanical products and systems.,
- Maintains and creates part and product documentation. ,
- Provides continuing aid to existing mechanical engineering departments. ,
- Participates in new product development.,
- Designs, develops, and builds assembly and product test fixtures.,
- Evaluates existing designs to improve reliability, decrease cost, reduce weight, and reduce assembly time.,
- Confirms system and product capabilities by designing feasibility and testing methods and properties.,
- Develops mechanical and electromechanical products by studying customer requirements; researching and testing  manufacturing and assembly methods and materials; and soliciting observations from operators/assemblers.,
- Assures system and product quality by designing testing methods; testing finished product, and system capabilities.,
- Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.,
- Completes projects by training and guiding technicians.,
- Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, participating in professional societies.,
- Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.,
- Applying knowledge of product design, fabrication, assembly, tooling and materials.,
- Soliciting observations from technicians. ,
,
Qualifications / Skills:,
Design skills ,
Organization/Document control,
Presenting technical information,
Communication skills,
Conceptual skills,
Quality focus,
General consulting skills,
Technical capabilities,
Knowledge of GD&T preferred,
 ,
Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements:,
Minimum 2 years’ experience working in the mechanical engineering field,
Proficient expertise with SolidWorks,
Experience with generating and maintaining part drawings and documentation,
Exceptional computer skills,
Good hands-on skills with assembling, building, troubleshooting electromechanical devices and fixtures. ,
Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering preferred,
,
This position is a full-time employment opportunity. We are looking for ambitious, hard-working and dedicated individuals who take great pride in their work. If this sounds like the right fit for you, please submit a detailed cover letter and your resume to be considered. ,
Thank you for your interest.,
